author: marylou

comments.content:
Hey Marylou

It could be this “Ol-Contact-Classic bold cond”

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/ol-contact-classic/bold-cond/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010131228/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/ol-contact-classic/bold-cond/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/ol-contact-classic/bold-cond/")

With a little ajustments perhaps?

Mark
Whatthefont.com shows the closest matches to be Hancock and Finalia. Maybe it’s a derivation of either.
The uppercase _R_ looks very geometric, all straight lines and perfect quarter circles, and lack optical correction where the curves go into straight lines. Could this be a custom designed logo?
Possibly. It is from an old soup label produced pre-digitally that the company wants to now match on new labels.
you can start with Corvinus / Skyline / Eden
